Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 11:30AM Valgirl wrote: They need to do a biopsy to determine if it is cancer.  The pathology report will determine if it is or is not cancer,  not the ultrasound.   They may suspect but that is all.  So don't worry yet.  Hoping for a B9 result for you.
Posts.Title: OK, need biopsy. Snarky radiologist, too. iammommy janet58

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2011 09:32AM Valgirl wrote: Renner1 - My onco score is the same as yours 16 and my stats are the same.  No one recommended chemo for me.  I am older age 59.  From what I have read the higher grade tumors do better with chemo thant he lower grade ones.    You can go to the John Hopkins ask the expert site and get another opinion.  www.hoplkinsbreastcenter.org/services/ask_expert/ I
Posts.Title: Oncotype DX test score at 18 - chemo or not? julie775 Bamagirl2016

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2011 02:15PM Valgirl wrote: Rads are much more advanced than those from years ago.   I had IMRT which is more direct focused since my BC was in my left breast. There are many types of Rads.    My Dad died of Heart disease when he was 44 so I did not want to do anything that would be harmful or make me more susceptible to heart disease.   Oncotype 16 No chemo.
Posts.Title: Oncotype DX test score at 18 - chemo or not? julie775 Bamagirl2016

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 08:32AM Valgirl wrote: Years ago I had a sharp pain in my breast.  It turned out to be a fluid filled cyst and B9.   But do get checked out.
Posts.Title: Pain in breasts? mammafox tanlon75

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2011 01:41PM Valgirl wrote: Yes that is normal.  I had 3 nodes removed also on 9/30/10.  I still have some numbness but it is getting better as time goes on.
Posts.Title: Numbness in arm after SNB EClaire hezzy

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 02:03PM Valgirl wrote: I had the Shingles vaccine a couple of weeks ago.  My RO did say that I could take it while getting rads, but I decided to wait.  I know 3 people who have had shingles and wish they had the vaccine.    A friend who had undergone a bone marrow transplant for a blood problem got shingles and 1 year later still has the nerve pain although the shingles are gone.  That is a rare occurance though.  She did great with her transplant and I guess her immune system was compromised and she got shingles.   So I recommend if you can to talk to your Dr. and get the vaccine.   Dr. Andrew Weil (natural health Dr. online) recommeds it.  It's very safe.
Posts.Title: Shingles >:-( lago Teka

Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Carola32 maltomlin

Posts.Content: May 16, 2011 08:28AM Valgirl wrote: I had no problems with the MRI dye injection.  Very easy.  I drove myself to the appointment.     For the lumpectomy - that was my very first surgery with going under anesthesia.  I did fine with that too.  They did my sentinal node biopsy while under anesthesia so I was not aware of the blue dye injection for that.  My recovery was fine - went out to lunch the next day with friends.   I only took 1/2 of a pain pill the afternoon of surgery and none needed after that.
Posts.Title: MRI - Dye Injection then Lumpectomy pil pil

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2011 05:19PM Valgirl wrote: Had lumpectomy on a Thursday morning.   Went out to lunch on Friday with friends and went to work Monday morning.   About a 2 and 1/2 inch incision for the lumpectomy on my left breast left side of breast.  A small incision for the SNB.  By the way I was not awake for the dye for the SNB.  It was done while I was in surgery.   Good luck with your surgery.
Posts.Title: lumpectomy recovery? debbsie jancie

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 03:13PM Valgirl wrote: I do belive they look at the grade of the tumor along with the oncotype.   Chemo works on more aggressive tumors.   My oncotype was 16 (higher end of low risk) and my grade was 1.  No chemo and my Onc said no one would recommed chemo for me.   My sister in law had same stats grade 1 but intermediate oncotype grade 23 and no chemo either.
Posts.Title: Anyone with an intermediate oncotype? Lovelillian nem126

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 04:03PM Valgirl wrote: njmae - I am sending you best wishes and good thoughts for a B9 result.   I was diagnosed in Sept. with a 8mm tumor.  I had a ultrasound 6 months prior where that radiologist did not pick it up.  I switched to a center that had the newer digital mammogram and they picked it up.   I prayed so much for it to be B9 but it was not.  I never thought I could handle something like this.  But I am and I can.   I was very fortunate that it was a low stage and grade and only needed the lumpectomy and radiation and have a excellent prognosis.   Thank goodness you keep up with screenings.  If it is anything, it can be handled, especially being so small.   It's normal to think the worst and what if's.  That helps us to prepare ourselves for any outcome.   "What's the worst that can happen" is the question I usually ask and it's never been that bad.  Yours won't be either.    Good luck and let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Biopsy tomorrow - very petrified njmae Makratz

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2011 02:26AM Valgirl wrote: I also had your stats although you don't mention your grade or age.  I was 59 at diagnois, onco type 16,  had lumpectomy, radiation, and now take arimidex (left breast).   No problems with radiation or arimidex.  I think it depends on age, etc.  I did lots of research and feel comfortble with all my decisions so far.  I think the RO told me of a local recurrance rate of 30-40% without having the rads.  Do your research, talk it over with your Doc's and good luck.
Posts.Title: have idc - radiation? yes/no bethannhg Curlylocks

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2011 02:22PM Valgirl wrote: I have my 1st post lumpectomy diagnostic mammogram/ultrasound 3rd week of June.  I feel comfortable with that as it is the newer digitial mammogram.   I had switched centers after learning of the new digital mammograms.  6 months before diagnosis I was being followed up by another center who had the old type mammogram.   I wonder if I had switched sooner if they would have caught it earlier.   I had the MRI after biopsy and everything that showed in the mammo and ultrasound was the same as the MRI.    I think a lot of it has to do with the radiologist who reads the mammo also.  It's important to go to a center that has lots of experience and a experienced radiologist in breast imaging.  The place I go is a Center of Excellence rated by the American College of Radiology.

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 10:31AM Valgirl wrote: AnneWisc - I thin it is very important to make sure you choose a treatment center/radiation oncologist who is experienced with the breast.    Go for another opinion.   At the top right of the screen on this site is the search button.  From there you can type in keywords that you want to search.   Good luck and let us know how it goes!
Posts.Title: APBI, Brachytherapy - anyone? AnneWisc kira1234

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 12:50PM - edited Feb 18, 2011 12:51PM by Valgirl I chose lumpectompy + radiation because I was not ready to deal with the loss of a breast. I have a scar on the left side of my left breast which I can't even see unless I turn to the side.   The tumor was small 8mm and I had no lymph node involvement.  My oncotype was 16 so no chemo.   I am happy with my decision.   I just was not ready for a major surgery (this was the first surgery I ever had).    I had no problems with the lumpectomy or radiation and now no problems with Arimidex.     Best Wishes on your decision.
Posts.Title: What were the reasons that you had a MX versus a lumpectomy geogal anneflorida

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2011 11:26AM Valgirl wrote: Some have done well with the internal radiation.  I had the external IMRT (more targeted) and did fine.  Ask lots of questions.

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2010 03:56PM Valgirl wrote: Jp3, You are only days out of surgery.  My BS did not let me do Yoga for 1 month after surgery.  I did do some gentle stretches and could not wait to get back to Yoga.  I've done TaiChi in the past and my Yoga teacher incorporates some TaiChi in her classes.  I had pain and numbness under my arm after my surgery for a few weeks.   Both are gradually getting better.     I am going through Radiation now.  Just finished #13 of 30.  No problems so far.   Good Luck and feel free to ask any questions.
